summary: The Florida Coastal Protection Act (H.R. 2673) aims to prohibit oil and natural gas exploration, development, and production in specific areas off the coast of Florida. This includes areas in the Eastern Gulf of Mexico, the South Atlantic Planning Area south of a certain latitude, and the Straits of Florida Planning Area. The bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to enforce these restrictions, with a clause stating that it does not affect existing leases.
